required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bioavailabity of the Major Metabolites of a Botanical Extract, in Healthy Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Bioavailabity of the Major Metabolites of a Botanical Extract, in Healthy Adults : a Randomized, Cross-over, Open-label, Clinical Study

collaborator.agency: CIC Inserm 1405, University Hospital Clermont-Ferrand, France

brief_summary.textblock:
Scientific research on the beneficial effects of botanical extracts has led to a better understanding of the role of its bioactive compounds, but the bioavailability in human remains largely unknown. Indeed, the most of publications investigated the bioavailability of metabolites of spices in in vitro cells model or animal experiments but few clinical studies have been conducted.
Therefore, the aim of this study is to characterize and quantify in blood, the main metabolite compounds of a botanical extract, following its administration by different routes (oral or sublingual) and with different preparations (extract or powder), in quantity equivalent to those having demonstrated biological properties.

primary_outcome.measure: (AUC 0-t) : Area under the curve of the serum concentration of the main metabolites of the products.
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 0 to 180 min after product ingestion

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC 0-t for the main metabolites of the products.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 0 to 180 min after product ingestion

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum peak concentration (Cmax) of the metabolites of the tested products.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 0 to 180 min after product ingestion

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to serum peak concentration (Tmax) of the metabolites of the tested products.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 0 to 180 min after product ingestion

secondary_outcome.measure: Elimination half-life (T1/2) of serum metabolites of the tested products defined by the time required for the concentration of product metabolites to decrease to half of Cmax.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 0 to 180 min after product ingestion

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration of urinary crocetin (ng/mg of creatinine) of the tested products at the end of the visit

other_outcome.measure: AUC(0-t) of the main volatile metabolite of the tested products in serum
other_outcome.time_frame: From 0 to 180 min after product ingestion
other_outcome.description: Determination and comparison between SBE and DBE

other_outcome.measure: Cmax of the main volatile metabolite of the tested products in serum
other_outcome.time_frame: From 0 to 180 min after product ingestion
other_outcome.description: Determination and comparison between SBE and DBE

other_outcome.measure: Tmax of the main volatile metabolite of the tested products in serum
other_outcome.time_frame: From 0 to 180 min after product ingestion
other_outcome.description: Determination and comparison between SBE and DBE

other_outcome.measure: T1/2 of the main volatile metabolite of the tested products in serum
other_outcome.time_frame: From 0 to 180 min after product ingestion
other_outcome.description: Determination and comparison between SBE and DBE
